snippet.title: Running with iOS: Strava Run vs. RunKeeper vs. Nike+
snippet.description: ...In May of 2006, Apple teamed up with Nike to announce a running tracker for use with the iPod nano... days earlier. snippet.title: Reader favorites: fitness tech for the geeks in us
snippet.description: ...Forget the old stereotype that geeks don't work out. There are so many of us now that there are plenty of mini-demographics within our rapidly growing group. But since we are geeks, we still have a thing for the gadgets, software, and devices that help us achieve our fitness goals. After all, things are still fun to play with even if they do force us to get up out of our chairs every once in...

snippet.title: Preschoolers better at navigating iPhone than tying their shoes
snippet.description: ...Hand a two-year-old child a shoe and she will probably end up throwing it. Hand her an iPhone, however, and she'll navigate through it to find her favorite app in no time. Those are two lessons that I (and other members of the Ars staff) have learned first-hand in recent years, but it's not just us. According to a new survey from security software maker AVG, kids can grasp new tech skil...
